publicationstmt.publisher: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-04-10 19:09:37 -0400.

repository.corpname: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

physdesc.extent: 26 oversize boxes, 5 letter size document boxes, 3 flag boxes, 2 record cartons, 2 half letter size document boxes, 1 legal size document box, and 1 oversize folder

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into four series: Memorabilia; Publications; Exhibit Materials; Photographs.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Donated from various Tufts NROTC/V-12 veterans.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains Navy V-12 Program publications, scrapbook, sword, aviation equipment, and military accessories. Also included are records from Army ROTC.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Objects related to the NROTC may be found in the David and Howard Arthur Lincon Collection (MS035).

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Navy V-12 Program was established in 1942 as part of the Naval Reserve Officers Training Corps to provide accelerated officer training at American colleges and universities in support of the war effort. During its existence at Tufts, more than 4,000 officers received their training on the Medford campus. Students enrolled in the program were able to complete their college studies, supplemented with special military training, prior to being commissioned in the navy. The School for War Service was organized to administer the naval programs.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection contains some restricted material. Restrictions related to specific material are listed in the detailed contents list. This collection may require review before it is available for use. Please contact DCA for further details.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. No documentation is available regarding the intellectual property rights in this collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains memorabilia donated by various Tufts V-12/NROTC veterans, including a dress sword, class ring, aviation equipment, and midshipman's and officer's hats.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged as found.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Scrapbook divided into 3 boxes. This box contains pages 1-42. The scrapbook was created and maintained by the V-12/NROTC staff and was housed in their offices. Bill Kirkpatrick E'46 had a son who was in the last NROTC class at Tufts and he saved the book from being thrown away. The scrapbook was given by Kirkpatrick (the son) to Bill Kirkpatrick for his 50th reunion, after which it was given to Herbert Nelson E'46 for safekeeping because Nelson lived on Cape Cod and Kirkpatrick lived in California and did not want to take it back across country with him. John Rodgers learned of its whereabouts and transported it to Tufts University Archives in 2000.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Scrapbook divided into 3 boxes. This box contains pages 43-84. The scrapbook was created and maintained by the V-12/NROTC staff and was housed in their offices. Bill Kirkpatrick E'46 had a son who was in the last NROTC class at Tufts and he saved the book from being thrown away. The scrapbook was given by Kirkpatrick (the son) to Bill Kirkpatrick for his 50th reunion, after which it was given to Herbert Nelson E'46 for safekeeping because Nelson lived on Cape Cod and Kirkpatrick lived in California and did not want to take it back across country with him. John Rodgers learned of its whereabouts and transported it to Tufts University Archives in 2000.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Scrapbook divided into 3 boxes. This box contains pages 85-128. The scrapbook was created and maintained by the V-12/NROTC staff and was housed in their offices. Bill Kirkpatrick E'46 had a son who was in the last NROTC class at Tufts and he saved the book from being thrown away. The scrapbook was given by Kirkpatrick (the son) to Bill Kirkpatrick for his 50th reunion, after which it was given to Herbert Nelson E'46 for safekeeping because Nelson lived on Cape Cod and Kirkpatrick lived in California and did not want to take it back across country with him. John Rodgers learned of its whereabouts and transported it to Tufts University Archives in 2000.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Donor: John A. Hickey. Kneeboard is worn strapped to aviator's knee, giving him a writing surface when needed. Also holds or displays documents required for mission. Attached to knee board are the Air Traffic Control guidelines for flight operations flying for the U.S.S. Intrepid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Donor: John A. Hickey. Computer used for computing the aircraft's flight path, incoprorating such items as wind speed and direction, and correction of aircraft's airspeed based on altitude and other considerations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Donor: John A. Hickey. Helmet is decorated in the squadron colors for Helicopter Combat Support Squadron Two (HC-2) who were nicknamed "Fleet Angels" for their role in the rescue of downed aviators. As Officer-in-Charge of the rescue detachment, John A. Hickey wore this helmet during the period 1967-1969 on board the aircraft carrier U.S.S. Intrepid (CVA-11) off the coast of Vietnam.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Donor: John A. Hickey. This oxygen mask was required for flight above 10,000 feet (but not in helicopters).

scopecontent.p: Donor: Peter Merenda. Section 4 in box. This bracelet was a supplement to the ID tags worn by naval ensigns. It is inscribed with information about the donor, including his Navy officer's file number blood type, and religion.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Donor: Peter Merenda. This is the watch he was instructed by the U.S. Navy to buy in preparation for deployment on a Mine Sweeper during World War II. Its features, such as a luminous dial and non-magnetic aluminum construction made it particularly suited for this work. The current watch band is not the original band.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains publications relating to NROTC/V-12. The "Tufts Tracer" NROTC/V-12 student paper started in September 1941 and published inconsistently until June 1943 when it became more professional and was published bimonthly. Present from years 1941-57. The "Shakedown" is the Naval Reserve Officers Training Corps yearbook. First issue 1946.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged chronologically within each publication.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contain exhibit materials used for the V-12/NROTC exhibits displayed in Tisch Library. Included are mounted labels and photographs from the V-12 collection and several reproduced photographic prints.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged as found.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Labels and mounted photographs and images.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Labels and photographs from exhibit II. Three folders have been added from the MS029 collection documentation file. A folder titled Background Info contains photocopies collected in preparation for one of the four exhibits. A folder titled Exhibit 1 contains correspondence and photocopies collected in preparation for Exhibit I. Also included is a folder titled V-12/NROTC Exhibit II Research/Doc. To Be Used Photo Copies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: All exhibit labels and photographs from exhibit IV. One folder has been added from the MS029 collection documentation file, titled V-12 Exhibit #4 (2002-03). It contains correspondence and photocopies of documents collected in preparation for the exhibit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Labels and photographs from exhibit III. All labels and mounted photographs belonging to John Zamparelli were given to him, 3/5/03. Three folders have been added from the MS029 collection documentation file, all of which contain photocopies of documents collected in preparation for the exhibit. The folders are titled: Exhibit 3; V-12 Exhibit 3 - Object List; and Future V-12/NROTC Exhibits

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series documents the V-12/NROTC Memorial Fund Program. Records created and compiled by program coordinator Ellie Short include correspondence, meeting minutes, and memos related to fundraising, awards, and the NROTC display case in Tisch Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged as received from Ellie Short.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: 75 years from the date of creation. 20 years from date of creation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains film reels and plans for a World War II memorial. These materials are unprocessed and may not be available for research. Please contact DCA for more information about access.
